meanings.sent1: The night was mothiest when the streetlights attracted all the insects.
meanings.sent2: The attic was the mothiest place in the house, filled with fluttering wings.
meanings.sent3: The mothiest sweater in the closet seemed to have holes that appeared overnight.
meanings.sent4: Her fascination with light made her the mothiest person at the party, always drawn to the brightest spot.
meanings.sent5: The forest at dusk was so mothiest that it felt like a fluttering blanket around us.

meanings.definition: Having the characteristics of a moth.
meanings.sent1: The mothiest wings of the butterfly fluttered gracefully in the garden.
meanings.sent2: She had the mothiest eyes, always fluttering and curious.
meanings.sent3: The mothiest behavior of the children at the campfire attracted the attention of the nearby fireflies.
meanings.sent4: His voice had a mothiest quality, soft and delicate like a moth's wings brushing against a window.
meanings.sent5: The room was filled with the mothiest scent of lavender, calming and gentle.

meanings.definition: Resembling a moth in appearance or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The mothiest costume at the party had delicate wings and fuzzy antennae.
meanings.sent2: Her movements were the mothiest, fluttering from one task to another.
meanings.sent3: The mothiest painting in the gallery seemed to come alive with its fluttering brushstrokes.
meanings.sent4: The old house had a mothiest charm, with its faded wallpaper and fluttering curtains.
meanings.sent5: The garden was the mothiest place in town, with flowers that seemed to dance like moths in the moonlight.
